data: The Forks | p'int above the courthouse | hill

Aunt Ailsie first heard the news from her son’s wife, Ruthena, who, returning from a trading trip to The Forks, reined in her nag to call,—“Maw, there’s a passel of quare women come in from furrin parts and sot 'em up some cloth houses there on the p’int above the courthouse, and carrying on some of the outlandishest doings ever you heared of. And folks a-pouring up that hill till no jury can’t hardly be got to hold court this week.”
